Cuban soup kitchen sees soaring demand as economic crisis deepensCuban Elda William, a 60-year old former psychologist, had been making ends meet selling cellphone plans - until a sewage pipe at her home office burst, putting off prospective clients. Fri, 19 Jan 2024 11:12:04 GMT 6TO4SN6ISZKWZNRCILGODWVPNA https://www.reuters.com/world/americas/cuban-soup-kitchen-sees-soaring-demand-economic-crisis-deepens-2024-01-19/Alien Fernandez, Dave Sherwood世界美洲
Kremlin says it regrets Argentina's decision not to join BRICS, hopes it reconsidersThe Kremlin said on Friday it regretted Argentina's decision not to join the BRICS bloc of nations and hoped that Buenos Aires would reconsider. Fri, 19 Jan 2024 11:08:33 GMT QFLAHZD4XRNPDEHOU5ANC2F6WI https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/kremlin-says-it-regrets-argentinas-decision-not-to-join-brics-hopes-it-reconsiders-2024-01-19/Reuters世界欧洲
EU says it is concerned by Kyrgyz crackdown on independent mediaThe European Union expressed concern on Friday about the detention of a number of journalists in Kyrgyzstan and searches at the offices of media outlets which have been critical of the government. Newborn baby found alive in shopping bag in freezing temperatures - London policeA newborn baby girl is in hospital after being found wrapped in a towel in a shopping bag on a London street, British police said on Friday as the capital was experiencing sub-zero temperatures. Fri, 19 Jan 2024 10:55:14 GMT YEZ27YSG3ZI57NJRZAGBMZTD5Y https://www.reuters.com/world/uk/newborn-baby-found-alive-shopping-bag-freezing-temporals-london-police-2024-01-19/Reuters世界英国
North Korea teens get 12 years' hard labour for watching K-pop - videoVideo footage released by an organisation that works with North Korean defectors shows North Korean authorities publicly sentencing two teenagers to 12 years' hard labour for watching K-pop. Fri, 19 Jan 2024 10:38:24 GMT FDIWI67HMJJHHDYBRYKGI5UWLE https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/north-korea-teens-get-12-years-of-hard-labour-watching-k-pop-video-2024-01-19/Minwoo Park, Jimin Jung世界亚太地区
Ireland launches legal case against UK over Northern Ireland amnesty lawThe European Court Of Human Rights said on Friday that Ireland had launched a legal challenge against Britain over a new law that gives conditional amnesties to former soldiers and militants involved in decades of violence in Northern Ireland. Labour-hungry Germany to ease citizenship path despite migration rowsGermany is expected on Friday to approve a law that shortens the path to citizenship and makes it easier to hold multiple nationalities, moves designed to ease crippling labour shortages by making the country more attractive to migrant workers. Fri, 19 Jan 2024 10:12:30 GMT MVUYMF2CBBK3PBPSGBCM2I532M https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/labour-hungry-germany-ease-citizenship-path-despite-migration-rows-2024-01-19/Thomas Escritt世界欧洲
Assets seized in Singapore money laundering case swell to $2.2 bln - mediaAssets seized in Singapore's biggest money laundering case have risen to more than S$3 billion ($2.24 billion) from S$2.8 billion in October, Singapore's Business Times reported on Friday. Philippines, Canada sign agreement on defence cooperationThe Philippines and Canada signed a memorandum of understanding on defence cooperation on Friday, a move which Manila's defence minister said could later lead to a troop pact between the two countries.
